item.title: Comment on Trump City by Lulu
item.description:
Hope this is a joke. If not, disappointed to see Alex take such a silly position the only justification of which could be to “stick it to the libs”

I’m all for the freedom city proposal, but disappointed to see this kind of political hackery on MR

item.title: Comment on Trump City by sailordave
item.description:
Why not start with Central Park or the Washington Mall?

the Presidio is a fantastic mixed residential, retail, offices, and park. it has new housing, huge crowds on the weekends, and is one of the best experiences in the Bay.

I hope you aren't serious about tearing down a successful development.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/12/trump-city.html?commentID=160844708

item.title: Comment on Trump City by Ray
item.description:
Reply to Lulu:

Hope this is a joke. If not, disappointed to see Alex take such a silly position the only justification of which could be to “stick it to the libs”

I’m all for the freedom city proposal, but disappointed to see this kind of political hackery on MR

I think it's because if you call it Trump City it will be a priority for the president. But it is undeniably hilarious to put a libertarian paradise Trump City in the middle of San Francisco. The private police force will be very busy on border enforcement.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/12/trump-city.html?commentID=160844752

item.title: Comment on La ciudad lineal by Raghu Parthasarathy
item.description:
The best reason to build a city on a line is to maximize the time, expense, and inconvenience of transportation between arbitrary points. The second best reason is that you've got tons of money, zero understanding of geometry, and a political system that doesn't tolerate criticism.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/12/la-ciudad-lineal.html?commentID=160844670
